conbody.p: More generally, stop clients from dictating unscalable solutions because they have no experience of scale whereas we do. Scale always magnifies the slightest inconsistencies and errors which are invisible at the small scale normally encountered in a customer's daily life. These invisible problems become highly visible and thus problematic to us when we are working on lots of their files at once.
Conversely, it is much more profitable to work on big projects than small ones!
Dividing one big potentially profitable project into 4 small projects potentially produces 4 unprofitable projects because of all the task switching with other projects going on simultaneously.
However, we should still do a PoC on the square root of the number of documents involved if we are unfamiliar with the source xml.
Every-one should read: "The Mythical Man Month"!!!!!
